patterns.title: Singleton
patterns.description: Ensure a class only has one instance, and provide a global point of access to it.

patterns.title: Adapter
patterns.description: Convert the interface of a class into another interface clients expect. Adapter lets classes work together that couldn't otherwise because of incompatible interfaces.

patterns.title: Composite
patterns.description: Compose objects into tree structures to represent part-whole hierarchies. Composite lets clients treat individual objects and compositions of objects uniformly.

patterns.title: State
patterns.description: Allow an object to alter its behavior when its internal state changes. The object will appear to change its class.

patterns.title: Strategy
patterns.description: Define a family of algorithms, encapsulate each one, and make them interchange­able. Strategy lets the algorithm vary independently from clients that use it.

patterns.title: Template Method
patterns.description: Define the skeleton of an algorithm in an operation, deferring some steps to sub­classes. Template Method lets subclasses redefine certain steps of an algorithm without changing the algorithm's structure.
